duties_responsibilities.duty: Prepare, analyze, and report on financial results, creating accounting policies and serving as a key resource to interpret and provide solutions to technical accounting and business issues.
Assist in preparation of financial statements, footnotes and MD&A for inclusion in quarterly and annual SEC filings, ensuring compliance with U.S. GAAP and SEC requirements, including XBRL.
Research technical accounting topics, write accounting position memos, and implement new accounting standards.
Work on Sarbanes-Oxley 404 processes, policies, and procedures, and assist with cross-functional projects including financial planning and analysis.

Assist with key accounting processes including stock-based compensation, leases, goodwill, intangibles, and revenue, and partner with the legal and investor relations groups to support financial communications.
Critically assess financial reporting information received from other functions and service providers, and help coordinate quarterly review processes and audit procedures with external auditors.
Interface with the finance leadership team, public accountants, attorneys, internal departments, and focus on continuous improvement initiatives for financial reporting deliverables.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field (Master's preferred)
